body: in which case does microtime not contain mircoseconds?

rename.to: Random crash: Undefined offset: 1 in log Target

body: I suppose when microseconds equal to zero then value returned without floating part.

```php
while (true) list($a, $b) = explode('.', (string)microtime(true));
```
This will trigger the error for sure :)
@ischenko thanks, would you like to send a pull request to fix this?

issue.title: [2.0.13] Logger occasionally crashes due to integer microtime

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Sometimes on rare occasions `microtime(true)` will return a pure integer (without a decimal separator '.' character) which causes the new Yii 2.0.13 logger to crash.

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Logging. It happens randomly due to [this line](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/d0bf3cfeb4813cefbaa2e3ac0b6cbf0cbfa931c0/framework/log/Target.php#L364).

Try it yourself:
```
do {
    $string = StringHelper::floatToString(microtime(true));
} while (strpos($string),'.') !== false);
```

### What do you get instead?

>Unable to send log via yii\log\FileTarget: PHP Notice 'yii\base\ErrorException' with message 'Undefined offset: 1' in ****/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/log/Target.php:364

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.13
| PHP version      | 7.0.22
| Operating system | Ubuntu

issue.title: PHP error in logger while formatting timestamp for output

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
You do not check situations when float timestamp value can be without microseconds (for example when log item was added at 123456.0000000)

### What steps will reproduce the problem?

1) Configure logger with flush interval = 1 and export interval = 1
2) Run next code 

```php
    $iter = 1000000;
    while ($iter-- > 0) {
        \Yii::warning('New log message');
    }
```

### What is the expected result?

Correct work without issues

### What do you get instead?

PHP undefined index in next line in Yii's `log/Target.php`:

```php
list($timestamp, $usec) = explode('.', StringHelper::floatToString($timestamp));
```

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.13
| PHP version      | 7.1.11
| Operating system | Ubuntu 16.04
